hakaisalmon 0.1.0

hakaisalmon: Hakai Institute Juvenile Salmon Program data

hakaisalmon.Rd

The hakaisalmon package is primarily a data package that contains the most up to date versions of the Hakai Institute Juvenile Salmon Program (JSP) data.

Usage

The purpose of this package is to make it easy to interact with JSP data. All program data is loaded into memory upon calling `library(hakaisalmon). You will not see datatables as objects in your environment but to demonstrate that the data is loaded into memory begin to type `survey` in your script and you should see several JSP data tables pop up in the tab completion window.

All the tables from the program database are available indvidually. However, some of the more common joins have already be completed for convenience. The common joins available are:

  • `survey_seines` - Joins survey and seine data

  • `fish_data` - Joins fish_field_data with fish_lab_data

  • `survey_seines_fish` - Joins survey_seines with fish_data

  • `survey_seines_fish_stock_id` - Joins survey_seines_fish with stock_id

If you wish to join other tables you can do so using the dplyr::left_join function. If this is something you have to do often, consider including your custom join in this package by contacting the maintainer.

The tables in this package follow a relational database structure. To see a visual depiction of the database structure see this entity-relationship-diagram.

A full list of the tables in this datapackage and descriptions of their variables can be found here.

Contribution

I appreciate feedback on how this package can better fulfill your needs. If you have custom functions that apply to JSP data, consider including them in this package. Contributing is best done using GitHUB, through the fork and pull-request model. Otherwise email requests are encouraged.

Permissions and Updates

This is a private package, and the user token you generated to install this package must not be shared. This package contains the most current data available. There is currently no effort to release versions of this package or to assign a DOI to cite this package. This package will be updated continually as new data are added. While the data in this package has been thoroughly QC'd it is not meant for pubclication. Citable datapackages are available for that.

To ensure you have the most up to date data available while using this package, remember to regularly update it using the same procedure you used to install it for the first time.

To update

  • Go to https://github.com/settings/tokens

  • click `Generate New Token`

  • click the box next to `repo` and;

  • scroll down to click generate new token

  • copy the token

  • return to the R console and type: devtools::install_github('hakaiinstitute/hakaisalmon', auth_token = "PASTE YOUR TOKEN HERE")

Maintainer
